Description: Fragment from neck (?) of a large thick-walled pottery jar (? - or roof-tile) stamped with a rectangular stamp with the faint design of two flowers or leafy branches back to back; clay brick red with grey core, coarse, micaceous with much chaff, some lime and other inclusions; thin white slip on outside.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The findspot is conjectural as the piece does not appear on the list of objects sent by the EEF.

The piece is very similar to British Museum 1925,0119.816 (totally without provenance), the stamp possibly from the same die. Perhaps too small to be a cover tile, though the possibility should be retained. At any rate the provenance of Naukratis must be assured for both pieces.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (AC.24)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.6065 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
